item.title: 在亚马逊和 SpaceX 案件中，美国劳工委员会的权力岌岌可危
item.description: 美国劳工委员会的执法权力在一系列诉讼中受到挑战，该委员会将在美国一家保守的上诉法院为自己辩护，以抵御埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）和亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）的攻击。【原文：A U.S. labor board whose enforcement powers are being challenged in a series of lawsuits is set to defend itself from attacks by Elon Musk's SpaceX and Amazon.com in a conservative U.S. appeals court, as the agency also braces for a potential overhaul under President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 波音任命前先锋集团首席执行官巴克利为董事会成员
item.description: 美国波音公司周五表示，波音董事会已选举前 Vanguard 集团首席执行官蒂姆-巴克利（Tim Buckley）为其最新成员，自 1 月 1 日起生效。【原文：Boeing board has elected former Vanguard Group CEO Tim Buckley as its newest member, effective Jan. 1, the U.S. planemaker said on Friday.】

item.title: FanDuel 与 MLB 工会就使用球员肖像的诉讼达成和解
item.description: 美国职业棒球大联盟（Major League Baseball）球员工会就一起诉讼达成和解，该诉讼指控体育博彩巨头 FanDuel 未经许可在其博彩平台上使用数百名 MLB 球员的姓名和肖像。【原文：Major League Baseball's players union settled a lawsuit that accused sports betting giant FanDuel of using the names and likenesses of hundreds of MLB players on its betting platform without permission.】

item.title: 强劲的美国数据继续重塑美联储对降息步伐和幅度的看法
item.description: 周五，强劲的美国经济和通胀数据继续重塑美联储决策者关于降息步伐和幅度的争论，投资者进一步下调了对央行在12月会议上降息的预期。【原文：Strong U.S. economic and inflation data on Friday continued reshaping the debate among Federal Reserve policymakers over the pace and extent of interest rate cuts as investors further downgraded their expectations for a rate reduction at the central bank's December meeting.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯在彭博电视上表示不排除 12 月降息的可能性
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周五表示，她希望看到更多数据，然后再决定央行是否应在下个月的政策会议上再次降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said Friday she wants to see more data before deciding whether the central bank should cut rates again at its policy meeting next month.】

item.title: 埃利奥特的 50 亿美元霍尼韦尔赌局：分拆是否会成功？
item.description: 长期以来，多元化企业集团一直是美国股市的一大特色，3M、通用电气（General Electric）、联合技术（United Technologies）等大公司为道琼斯工业指数（Dow industrials）提供了支撑。但其中许多公司后来分崩离析，其分拆公司的股价也一路飙升。【原文：Diversified conglomerates were long a fixture of the U.S. stock market landscape, with the Dow industrials bolstered by big names such as 3M, General Electric, United Technologies and others. But many of those companies have since broken apart, and shares of their spinoffs have surged.】

item.title: 新闻机构称苹果公司从俄罗斯应用程序商店删除了美国资助的 RFE/RL 新闻应用程序
item.description: 自由欧洲电台/自由电台周五表示，应俄罗斯国家通信监管机构Roskomnadzor的要求，苹果公司已从俄罗斯应用商店删除了自由欧洲电台/自由电台的一款俄语新闻应用程序。【原文：Apple has deleted one of U.S.-funded Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty's Russian-language news apps from the Russian App Store at the request of state communications regulator Roskomnadzor, the news outlet said on Friday.】

item.title: 马斯克扩大对 OpenAI 的诉讼范围，增加微软和反垄断指控
item.description: 亿万富翁企业家埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）扩大了对聊天软件制造商 OpenAI 的诉讼范围，增加了联邦反垄断和其他索赔，并将 OpenAI 最大的财政支持者微软公司列为被告。【原文：Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk expanded his lawsuit against ChatGPT maker OpenAI, adding federal antitrust and other claims and adding OpenAI's largest financial backer Microsoft as a defendant.】

item.title: Palantir计划登陆纳斯达克，股价再创新高
item.description: Palantir Technologies Inc 周四晚些时候宣布将在纳斯达克上市，并有望获得加入纳斯达克 100 指数的资格，该公司股价周五上涨超过 6%，创下历史新高。【原文：Shares in Palantir Technologies Inc were up more than 6% on Friday, hitting a record high, after it announced late on Thursday that it would list on the Nasdaq and expects eligibility to join the Nasdaq 100 index .】

item.title: 曼哈顿美国检察官称将缩减加密货币案件数量
item.description: 一位高级检察官周五表示，在包括 FTX 创始人山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）在内的几起重大定罪之后，曼哈顿的美国检察官办公室将减少用于监管加密货币犯罪的资源。【原文：The U.S. Attorney's Office in Manhattan will devote fewer resources to policing cryptocurrency crimes after securing several major convictions, including that of FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried, a senior prosecutor said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国 9 月商业库存增幅低于预期
item.description: 由于零售商库存的增加被制造商和批发商库存的减少部分抵消，9 月份美国商业库存的增幅低于预期。【原文：U.S. business inventories increased less than expected in September as a rise in stocks at retailers was partially offset by declines at manufacturers and wholesalers.】

item.title: 受波音罢工和飓风持续拖累，美国 10 月工业生产下滑
item.description: 受飓风和波音公司工厂工人罢工的影响，10 月份美国工业生产连续第二个月下降，但随着这些因素的影响减弱，11 月份可能会出现反弹。【原文：U.S. industrial production fell for a second straight month in October, continuing to be depressed by hurricanes and a strike by factory workers at Boeing , but a rebound is likely in November as the drag from these factors lifts.】

item.title: 声称埃隆-马斯克操纵狗狗币的诉讼终结
item.description: 指控埃隆-马斯克操纵狗狗币的诉讼即将结束。【原文：A lawsuit accusing Elon Musk of rigging dogecoin is ending.】

item.title: 新兴市场股票出现 2020 年以来最大月度外资流出，债券仍在坚挺
item.description: 一家银行业贸易集团周五公布的数据显示，10 月份外国投资者抛售新兴市场股票的数量创下了自 2020 年初 COVID-19 市场抛售以来的最高纪录，但流入新兴市场债券和债务的资金超过了流出量。【原文：Foreign investors sold out of emerging market stocks in October by the most since the COVID-19 market sell-off in early 2020, but inflows to EM bonds and debt more than offset the outflow, data from a banking trade group showed on Friday.】

item.title: 奥地利 OMV 公司通过乌克兰过境运输的天然气从明天起降为零
item.description: 据周五在 CEGH Remit 平台上发布的信息，奥地利 OMV 公司已接到俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom）的通知，该公司将从格林尼治标准时间 11 月 16 日 0500 时起将天然气供应量降至零。【原文：Austria's OMV has been informed by Gazprom that the Russian gas producer would reduce its deliveries of natural gas from to zero from 0500 GMT on Nov. 16, according to information published on the CEGH Remit platform on Friday.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统表示，无需财政改革，墨西哥仍有提高税收的空间
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）周五表示，墨西哥明年还有增加税收的空间，无需进行深入的财政改革。【原文：Mexico has room to boost tax revenues next year without turning to a deep fiscal reform, President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Friday, as her government is expected to present its budget proposal later in the day.】

item.title: 消息人士称 Northvolt 已考虑在美国寻求破产保护
item.description: 两位知情人士告诉路透社，瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt 一直在讨论在美国寻求破产保护的可能性，这也是这家资金短缺的公司生存下去的几种选择之一。【原文：Swedish battery maker Northvolt has been discussing the possibility of bankruptcy protection in the United States as one of several options for the cash-strapped company to survive, two people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 安巴尼的信实公司要求印度审查马斯克的 "星链 "和亚马逊的覆盖范围
item.description: 周五的一封信显示，亿万富翁穆克什-安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）的信实公司（Reliance）要求印度电信监管机构在授予卫星频谱之前，审查埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的星链（Starlink）和亚马逊的Kuiper的潜在覆盖范围，因为他们担心本地企业可能会受到影响。【原文：Billionaire Mukesh Ambani's Reliance has asked India's telecom regulator to review the potential reach of Elon Musk's Starlink and Amazon's Kuiper before awarding satellite spectrum amid concerns local players could suffer, a letter showed on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，摩根大通在权衡伦敦总部的各种选择，因为金丝雀码头大厦已无法容纳它的规模
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，摩根大通正在评估其伦敦欧洲总部的选择方案，因为这家快速扩张的华尔街银行已经超出了其位于伦敦金丝雀码头金融区的现有大楼。【原文：JPMorgan is assessing options for its European headquarters in London as the fast-expanding Wall Street bank outgrows its existing tower in London's Canary Wharf financial district, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 俄罗斯 Sovcomflot 公司将盈利下降归咎于西方制裁
item.description: 俄罗斯领先的油轮集团 Sovcomflot 周五表示，西方对俄罗斯油轮的制裁限制了其财务业绩，因为该公司报告的收入和核心盈利都在下降。【原文：Russia's leading tanker group Sovcomflot said on Friday that Western sanctions on Russian oil tankers were limiting its financial performance, as it reported falling revenues and core earnings.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯称技术变革可改善金融体系
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周五表示，美国中央银行需要密切关注金融系统的技术发展。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said Friday the U.S. central bank needs to keep a close watch on technological developments in the financial system.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份进口价格意外上涨
item.description: 由于燃料和其他商品价格上涨，10月份美国进口价格意外上涨，这是近几个月来美国在降低通胀方面缺乏进展的最新迹象。【原文：U.S. import prices unexpectedly rose in October amid higher prices for fuels and other goods, the latest indication of lack of progress lowering inflation in recent months.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，马斯克的 SpaceX 公司准备在 12 月以每股 135 美元的价格发起要约收购
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引知情人士的话报道称，埃隆-马斯克的 SpaceX 公司准备在 12 月发起要约收购，以每股 135 美元的价格出售现有股份。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX is preparing to launch a tender offer in December to sell existing shares at a price of $135 per share, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the discussions.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份零售销售略高于预期
item.description: 美国 10 月份的零售额增幅略高于预期，但消费者支出的基本势头在第四季度初似乎有所放缓。【原文：U.S. retail sales increased slightly more than expected in October, but underlying momentum in consumer spending appeared to slow at the start of the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 消息人士称通用汽车裁员近千人，其中大部分在美国
item.description: 一位消息人士周五告诉路透社，通用汽车公司正在全球范围内裁员近1000人，其中大部分在美国，因为该公司希望精简业务。【原文：General Motors is laying off nearly 1,000 workers worldwide, most in the U.S., as it looks to streamline operations, a source told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 企业盈利乐观，美国股票基金资金流入强劲
item.description: 截至11月13日的一周内，投资者对美国股票基金的需求大幅增加，原因是人们对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重新上台将改善美国企业盈利前景持乐观态度。【原文：U.S. equity funds witnessed a significant boost in investor demand in the week through Nov. 13, fueled by optimism that Donald Trump’s return to office would enhance the outlook for U.S. corporate earnings.】

item.title: 迪斯尼接近临界点，流媒体利润开始抵消有线电视的下滑
item.description: 2022 年，鲍勃-艾格重返华特迪士尼担任首席执行官，并大胆承诺要让流媒体盈利。【原文：Bob Iger returned to Walt Disney as CEO in 2022 with a bold promise of making streaming profitable.】

item.title: 格兰霍姆称，取消美国电动汽车税收抵免将让位于中国
item.description: 美国能源部长詹妮弗-格兰霍尔姆（Jennifer Granholm）周五在巴库举行的COP29气候大会上对记者说，取消美国电动汽车税收抵免将适得其反，并将把市场拱手让给中国的汽车制造商。【原文：Cancelling the U.S. electric vehicle tax credit would be counterproductive and cede ground to car-makers in China, U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm told reporters on Friday at the COP29 climate conference in Baku.】

item.title: 大手笔预算和特朗普获胜后，英国通胀忧虑升温
item.description: 就在英国似乎要摆脱通胀问题时，新政府的大肆挥霍以及美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税计划引发的全球贸易战风险却威胁着通胀问题的延续。【原文：Just when Britain seemed to be moving beyond its inflation problem, the new government's spending splurge and the risk of a global trade war triggered by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's tariff plan are threatening to extend it.】

item.title: 独家报道联合利华将欧洲裁员预期减半，部分员工转至冰淇淋部门--工厂委员会
item.description: 联合利华欧洲工作委员会负责人告诉路透社，联合利华在欧洲的裁员数量将比最初预计的少约 1500 人，并将为其即将分拆的冰淇淋业务招聘约 1000 人，主要是那些受其成本削减行动影响的员工。【原文：Unilever is cutting about 1,500 fewer jobs in Europe than initially anticipated and hiring about 1,000 people, primarily those affected by its cost-cutting drive, for its soon-to-be spun off ice cream business, the head of the company's European Works Council told Reuters.】
